duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead and participate in pathfinding activities for new patterning technology, including 193nm immersion, EUV, and high NA EUV.

Develop EUV modules in the technology development (TD) site, including setting up lithography processes and working with other process areas and process integration to meet manufacturing requirements.
Travel to support early learning for high NA EUV up to once a month.
Work closely with defect inspection teams and the mask shop to develop appropriate inspection strategies for EUV masks.
Collaborate with manufacturing sites to align on equipment and materials requirements, and ensure EUV processes are aligned for transfer.
Communicate effectively with groups across different departments, sites, and geographies, maintaining global alignment on photo materials and process conditions.

education_certification.credential: Ph.D. in Engineering, Chemistry, Physics with 3 years semiconductor process related experience with Photolithography, or a M.S / B.S. in Engineering, Chemistry, or Physics with 5 years semiconductor process related experience with emphasis on Photolithography.
